byline.contributor: Stanley Reed reported from London, and Clifford Krauss from Houston.
byline.original: By STANLEY REED and CLIFFORD KRAUSS

abstract: BP reports second-quarter loss of $5.8 billion, down from profit of $3.4 billion in year-earlier period; loss reflects roughly 40 percent fall in price of oil prices and huge settlement over the 2010 Gulf Mexico oil spill.
lead_paragraph: The roughly 40 percent fall in oil prices since last year is also sharply cutting into profits at the British company and at other oil companies.

headline.main: BP Posts Loss as Oil Spill Settlement and Sagging Demand Take Toll
headline.print_headline: Spill Settlement and Sagging Demand Combine for BP Loss
